selection_reasoning: We are selecting the two current leaders (3_6, 3_4) which introduced vectorized gradients and high-precision polishing. We also include symmetry-based (3_9) and DE-based (3_8) trials to maintain global search diversity and avoid local optima traps. The next generation will focus on the 'Iterative Polishing' and 'Hessian Reset' strategies suggested by the analysis.

trial_selections.reasoning: Current best score (1.00001591). Features a fully vectorized Jacobian and high-precision polishing. The query_llm analysis suggests this is the most robust local refinement approach.
Matches the best score. Uses a simulated annealing perturbation schedule which provides a different global search dynamic compared to standard basin-hopping.
Explores symmetry-constrained optimization (D4h/Oh). While the score is lower, it provides a fundamentally different way to reduce the search space and potentially find better basins.
Differential Evolution approach. Provides global search diversity that might find configurations that basin-hopping misses.
The original breakthrough trial. Still serves as a robust baseline for the basin-hopping approach.
